message.content:
cs.IT, cs.DS, cs.CR, cs.SI, cs.CC. 

The paper deals with the problem of securing data in distributed storage systems, which is a topic that falls under the umbrella of information theory (cs.IT). The use of linear codes and exact repair to recover from node failures suggests that the paper may also be relevant to the sub-category of distributed systems (cs.DS). The focus on security against eavesdropping implies that the paper may be related to the sub-category of cryptography (cs.CR). The new results on subspace intersection suggest that the paper may also be relevant to the sub-category of signal processing (cs.SI). Finally, the study of the maximum secure file size in different scenarios may involve computational complexity considerations, which could place the paper in the sub-category of computational complexity (cs.CC).
